summary.title: Material concerning the Edition of Knýtlinga saga of c. 1750
summary.note: Notes and drafts, written on paper of various sizes, for the edition of c. 1750 (AM 20 k fol). Divided into 23 parts.

handNote.p: The majority of the text is written by Jón Ólafsson of Grunnavík.
A minor part of the text is written by Eggert Ólafsson.
Three leaves are written by Hans Gram.

source.p: Katalogue text expanded 13 April 2021 by EW-J, so the content now corresponds to the catalogue text in Kålund's catalogue.

msItem.title: Thirty-One Scaldic Poems from Knýtlinga Saga
msItem.rubric: Ex hiſtoria, qvam vocant Knytlinga saga Cantilenæ
msItem.colophon: Ex avtographo ipsius authoris, Svenonis Jonæ, Sacerdotis Bardensis
msItem.note: Including a comment in Latin by the priest, Sveinn Jónsson of Barði, containing corrections.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated 1-7 + 1-6 (the latter inserted between ff. 3 and 4).

physDesc.additions:
A quire of six leaves in 4to: De Carminibus seu Cantilenis in hac Historiâ
occurentibus has been inserted between ff. 3 and 4. It is containing a criticism of the original comment written in Latin by Jón Ólafsson.

msItem.rubric:
Excerpta qvædam è Knytlinga-
Saga
msItem.note: Mainly extracts of geographic and chronologic content.

physDesc.additions: A loose slip containing critical commentaries regarding an edtion and translation of Herimskringla is added.

msItem.author: Hans Gram
msItem.title: Critical Comments to Knýtlinga saga
msItem.rubric: Historisk-kritiske bemærkninger til kap. 1-3 og 32 af Knytlinga saga

physDesc.additions: To this part a leaf in 8vo has been inserted - an account by Hans Gram concerning Canute VI and Gertrud's putative offspring.
